Articles.Content: ![kQipuvE.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/kQipuvE.jpg)
My jeb has been dead for atleast 3 years (In game)
Can't be true, i've seen him dying. A lot of times.

[https://www.facebook.com/nasasolarsystem/videos/10152831812042918/](https://www.facebook.com/nasasolarsystem/videos/10152831812042918/)

What was the point of blanking that out?

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Can't be true, i've seen him dying. A lot of times.

But he always comes back.

> 
> But he always comes back.

Who's Jebediah Kerman?

> 
> Who's Jebediah Kerman?

The physical manifestation of the Kerbal God.

> 
> [https://www.facebook.com/nasasolarsystem/videos/10152831812042918/](https://www.facebook.com/nasasolarsystem/videos/10152831812042918/)
> What was the point of blanking that out?
> 
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> But he always comes back.

I found it as an image that way
Quick! Everybody name your kids Jeb! In 83 years, we'll be golden!
*Technically,* they're not denying Jebediah Kerman is real...
Makes me wonder how many people actually voted for Jebediah.

Why wait for NASA?

Grab a chart of mercury and choose a nice feature and name it after Jebediah. As long as enough people refer to it by the Kerbal name, it will, eventually be called just that.

Maybe we can fill a petition to name geographical features on Pluto after fictional characters... Pluto was named after the dog afterall, right? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Maybe we can fill a petition to name geographical features on Pluto after fictional characters... Pluto was named after the dog afterall, right? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

It was named after a Roman god of death, which I think the dog was named after, IIRC.

he is out there...

whitepages.com knows him

[http://www.whitepages.com/search/FindPerson?utf8=%E2%9C%93&who=jebediah+kerman&where=](http://www.whitepages.com/search/FindPerson?utf8=%E2%9C%93&who=jebediah+kerman&where=)

besides, send such a request to the curiosity-team. the martian rocks and other features can be named after everything out there (and since those rovers last quite long, they need a lot of names). and hey, they publish papers all the time. this way the name jebediah kerman will be used in scientific papers ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Jeb already has [Kerman line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C3%83%C6%92%C3%82%C2%A1rm%C3%83%C6%92%C3%82%C2%A1n_line).

> 
> It was named after a Roman god of death, which I think the dog was named after, IIRC.

Haha, i knew. You should also google for "Project Pluto" it was named perfectly ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
And after all, the Roman god of Death isn't a fictional personage...

> 
> Maybe we can fill a petition to name geographical features on Pluto after fictional characters... Pluto was named after the dog afterall, right? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Check out the link in my sig, they accept applications for fictional explorers.

Edit: Never mind, the voting is over.

> 
> And after all, the Roman god of Death isn't a fictional personage...

At least not today ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> And after all, the Roman god of Death isn't a fictional personage...

Pluto is also not a feature on a celestial body. To the best of my knowledge of course. Or did it smack into Uranus?

> 
> Check out the link in my sig, they accept applications for fictional explorers.
> Edit: Never mind, the voting is over.

Wait... Kathryn Janeway made it but not Jeb?
We saved the ROUND-8, we can get some space agency somewhere to name something after Jebediah Kerman.

> 
> Pluto is also not a feature on a celestial body. To the best of my knowledge of course. Or did it smack into Uranus?

... I... can't read this as anything but a roundabout way of telling someone to shove a small planetoid up their butt.
